data.title: Unable to exit the prefix loop during detection of AoE2 installation
data.body:
When you use wine to detect the installation and are unable to enter a valid prefix you can't leave the loop. Or at least I didn't find how.

```
This does not appear to be a valid WINEPREFIX.
Enter a valid one, or leave it empty to skip.
WINEPREFIX=
This does not appear to be a valid WINEPREFIX.
Enter a valid one, or leave it empty to skip.
```

I was only able to leave this loop by sending a `Ctrl + C`

data.title: Packaging-related: multiarch installdir and version
data.body:
Changes the install dir for the lib to look like this on Debian: `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libopenage.so` to fix the multiarch packaging warnings. I hope it does nothing strange on mac.

Incremented the version to v0.3.1 to be able to build the deb package from the current sources. Can't add a git tag to the pull request (github can't do that), but the commit should be tagged with 'v0.3.1'.

data.title: Documentation for openage nyan usage
data.body:
This adds some documentation about our usage of nyan.
The documentation of nyan itself is in the nyan project repo, this is just about the openage specifics.

data.title: Fatal Python error: Py_Initialize: Unable to get the locale encoding
data.body:
I managed to keep getting this error trying to debug from my IDE while CLI worked fine. 

```
Fatal Python error: Py_Initialize: Unable to get the locale encoding

raise CodecRegistryError,\
```

This is caused by some Python 2.x/3.x conflict in gdb, the solution for my IDE (CLion) was to use gdb 7.11 instead of 7.8 (for me, file -> settings -> build, execution, deployment -> debugger ->  /usr/bin/gdb)

data.title: Building preview should show color of active player
data.body:
Currently always shows P1 blue. The constructed building shows the correct color.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/245867/15094755/b00e1022-1463-11e6-96e8-f268aac23e5f.png)

data.title: Disable friendly fire from projectiles
data.body:
It seems that getting in the way of your own projectiles causes friendly fire.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/245867/15094707/04e70416-1462-11e6-8655-5d4683eeb74b.png)

data.title: [WIP] Improving building logic
data.body:
Do not place conflicting buildings and/or foundations. Conflict with unit is OK to place foundation, although building construction cannot begin until the site has been cleared. Addresses second half of #533.

Fixes the two behaviors seen here:

![two_bad_building_behaviors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/245867/15038760/8894ecf0-125b-11e6-9245-50c49ff742b2.png)

data.title: Development cycle advice?
data.body:
Is this the best way to make changes?
1. Make change in .cpp
2. make
3. ./run
4. Navigate to "Generate Game" and keep pushing it until assets have loaded
5. Test behavior

Just wondering, because I've done this about 50 times tonight, and if there are any recommended shortcuts (filesystem watch to make? launch with flags to automatically load game after assets load?) that would be good to know :+1: I'm on Ubuntu.

(Forgive me, I come from interpreted language world where this is a different ballgame.)

data.title: Require harfbuzz version >= 1.x.x
data.body:
Fixes compile error on OS X with clang 3.8 in debug mode.

Other things we need to take care of if we require a newer harfbuzz version?

data.title: Update build procedure
data.body:
https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/master/doc/building.md#build-procedure
- [ ] The `./configure` script no longer accepts `--cpp-compiler`
- [ ] The compiler versions should not be hardcoded, but it's probably difficult writing it in another way
- [ ] Create subfiles for all the distros and operating systems, so the file is less clobbered

data.title: Header inclusion minimization
data.body:
In order to reduce compile times and prevent cyclic includes in the first place, all our files should be revisited:
- [ ] In all header files, only non-pointer or non-reference data types are included from another header
- [ ] All pointer or reference data types are forward declared in each header (`class Bla;`)
- [ ] In the corresponding c++ file, those incomplete types are imported by `#include "header"`

Thus, complete types are only included in files where they are needed.
Template stuff and inheritance parents etc must be included in header files directly of course.

data.title: Fixed osx clang compile errors.
data.body:
Cleanup of some include calls. Fixes #541.

Tested with current osx clang, osx g++ 5.3 (brew) as well as clang 3.5 and g++ 4.9.2 (both debian jessie).

data.title: Missing source in CMakeLists.txt in libopenage/util
data.body: Added missing os.cpp source.

data.title: AppImage packaging
data.body:
We should provide easy support to create an AppImage for openage.

https://github.com/probonopd/AppImageKit

Maybe there are other similar approaches, we should also work towards supporting them.

data.title: Limit fps
data.body:
This adds a command line argument `--fps` (to the game subcommand).

When `--fps` is supplied and greater than 0, the main loop will delay after each frame until 1/`fps_limit` seconds have passed.

The FPS limit is applied on top of VSync so it should only come into effect when it is set below the refresh rate you'd need for VSync or if the window is in the background.

data.title: Remove crossplatform folder
data.body:
Fixes #485 

I moved everything to util. I'm not that familiar with the code yet, so please tell me if something is a better fit for another folder.

data.title: Saving debug symbols
data.body: Even the release build of libopenage should be probably producing a separate file with debug symbols. And this file should be installed/distributed with the rest of the binaries.

data.title: Log levels and filtering
data.body:
We already have log levels, but all messages are printed to `stdout` right now.
This is the `stdout sink` of the logging subsystem.

Filtering for log origin is prepared, but not implemented.
- [ ] Implement more log sinks, for example for a specific unit, so we can print its messages in a console window flying above its head (#48)

data.title: Command queue, and fix building placement segfault
data.body:
Replace `unit.invoke(Command &)` with `unit.queue_cmd(Command &)` which queues commands to be applied at the next update. queue_cmd is safe to call from multiple threads.
 Building placement is fixed, as described in https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/issues/535
Also fixed an issue where gatherers would only return wood.

data.title: [doc-fix] adding the missing call to call in the cpp example
data.body: Because, I keep forgetting it.

data.title: Adding CVar subsystem
data.body:
See #486

Please overlook the crappy cython method didn't want to rewrite all the hardcoded keybind yet.
Keybinding set from python are working.

data.title: [WIP] Debian packaging
data.body:
Uses `git-buildpackage`. Packaging files are on a separate branch. master is merged into that branch to make a release. (so, this pull request is not for master, but for the debian branch or maybe a separate packaging repo)

```
# vars
DEBEMAIL="velorums@gmail.com"
DEBFULLNAME="velorums"
DEB_BUILD_OPTIONS="parallel=4"
export DEBEMAIL DEBFULLNAME DEB_BUILD_OPTIONS

# https://github.com/SFTtech/openage.git has 'master' and 'debian' branches
# 'master' won't contain any debian packaging-related files

# building a package
git checkout debian
gbp buildpackage

# making a new version
git checkout master
echo v0.3.2 > openage_version
git commit -m"Bumped version number to 0.3.2" openage_version
git tag v0.3.2
git checkout debian
git merge master
vi debian/changelog # add the version and a comment (TODO: 'gbp dch' may generate that)
git commit -m"changelog to 0.3.2" debian/changelog
```

data.title: Get rid of CMAKE_PY_INSTALL_PREFIX
data.body: Is it possible to make it dependent on the `CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` to free the cmake invocation from the python details?

data.title: Building placement problem
data.body:
It is possible to build on non buildable terrain (eg: water, ice) if it touch a walkable terrain. Destroying the building doesn't restore the previous terrain.

It is also possible to build stuff in a town center in some of its corner, try with house.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/32258650-building-placement-problem?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: doc: fix enumeration in damage calculation notes
data.body: Missing enumeration for attack and armor classes made them show up in a single line.

data.title: Game crash after loading
data.body:
To reproduce : 
- Generate a game
- Select all 3 blue villagers
- Ask them to build a house
- Make the 3 villagers build it on the same side (not sure if required)
- Save then quit the game (not openage) before the house is built
- Load the game (only 2 villagers should be present)
- Press 'M' to get back to the building mode, the game should crash

Might be related to #362

data.title: Network communication design

milestone.title: Architecture restructuring
milestone.description: New engine architecture is in place

data.body:
tl;wr: the server does all calculations, clients only render the state they received. state is transmitted by keyframes at "predicted" end points.

The design is pretty much like on would do it for a FPS.
[The basic idea is this](https://blog.forrestthewoods.com/the-tech-of-planetary-annihilation-chronocam-292e3d6b169a): The server sends a packet which updates the "target" state of the future for clients. They interpolate the received movement/update/... functions and try reaching the target state all the time.

```
server
------

* central trust instance for the game state.
* does all the calculations based on input events.
* create and distribute keyframes for all clients


clients
-------

* receive keyframes
* calculate world state for current time by interpolating keyframes
* display world state and fancy animations et
* send actions to server (timestamp is probably a bad idea)
```

This is the low-level part for transmitting the results of the simulation itself.

To understand how the prediction works, see #740.

data.title: [WIP] new savefile format with working triggers
data.body:
hi,

I tried to specify a new savefile format with triggers.
for information look at doc/map-format.md

with this generic trigger approach it is possible to implement nearly everything (example: relics gold,technologies)
relics:
condition: player-has relic => 0.2Gold/s

but before further implemantation, i would like your thoughts on this.
